description.text: Take this quiz to get a demonstration of what quizzy can do!

question.text: Each question has this block of question text

explanation.text: and each option can have a unique block of text to explain the scoring to the user.

question.text: You can add pictures to the quiz description, the question text,

explanation.text: and any explanation.

question.text: You can add as many questions as you'd like.

explanation.text: That means the user can't cheat by looking at the page source.

question.text: All the quiz data is based on XML so making quizzes is very easy.

explanation.text: You can also use the quizzyBuilder to make a quiz graphically.
Maybe, but you can also use the quizzyBuilder to make a quiz graphically.

question.text: Good browser compatibility! Tested in IE 6+, Firefox, Chrome, Safari 4+, Opera 8+, and Konqueror.

explanation.text: Nothing that shatters usability. Just one minor aesthetic bug in Opera really.
But there is just one minor aesthetic bug in Opera. Nothing that shatters usibility at all.

question.text: quizzy even works when the user has JavaScript disabled!

explanation.text: Each step of the quiz occurs after a form submit using GET. Give it a try, disable JavaScript and reload this page!

question.text: You can use Multiple-Choice Questions where you can assign an arbitrary number of points to each option.

explanation.text: You selected one so I gave you one. The highest score is considered the "best."
You selected two so I gave you two. The highest score is considered the "best."
You selected three so I gave you three. The highest score is considered the "best."
You selected four so I gave you four. The highest score is considered the "best."

question.text: You can use Select-All-That-Apply Question where each selected option adds a certain value to the user's score.

explanation.text: This type of question only has one explanation to explain all possible answers.

question.text: And you can use three different types of Text-Input Questions. This one takes a sentence and tries to be lenient when grading. Enter the string "Hello, happy world!"

explanation.text: You can specify more than one correct answer for these types of questions too. And each of those answers can provide a different score. Next time, try entering "Hi, happy world!."
Since you didn't do exactly what I asked, you only get 2 points for this answer.
You found the secret answer! But since you didn't do exactly what I asked, you only get 2 points for this answer.
You did not enter the text like I asked so you don't get any points.

question.text: This Text-based question is looking for an exact input. Use this for things like code. Enter the string "echo 'foobar' | grep foo"

explanation.text: You only got the points because you entered the string exactly correctly. Try changing it a bit next time.
You don't get any points because you didn't enter exactly that string.

question.text: The last Text-based question type is for numbers. quizzy parses the user input to a float value and offer's some wiggle room to the user (which is changable in the settings). Try entering 56.3 +/- 0.05

explanation.text: You got the points because you entered a value between 56.25 and 56.35
The number you entered must have been outside the range of 56.25 to 56.35

question.text: You can specify an explanation to use for all options, unique explanations for each option, or use no explanation at all.

explanation.text: This is not a standard explanation.
This is the standard explanation. For Text-based questions, this explanation would be used for all wrong answers.

question.text: It's easy to customize quizzy too. Just edit the quizzy_config.php file.

explanation.text: Instructs the user to pick a quiz.
Displayed to the user when they complete a quiz
Just change the width and height in the config file and quizzy takes care of the rest!

option.text: Don't want the users to see the correct answers?

explanation.text: Just change the setting and quizzy will advance to the next question after the user answers.
Specifies the range where quizzy will consider a number answer correct.
You bet! You can even set several options relating to how the jQuery animations work.

question.text: As many quizzes as you want from as many xml files you want.

explanation.text: No problem. Each quiz will appear in the list.
Go ahead. It won't look any different to the user.

question.text: quizzy also features a robust scoring system where you can define grades and ranks to percent correct.

explanation.text: You can even add a unique picture for each rank. Have a look at your score, rank, and grade after clicking 'Next!'
